name: PublishDacPacTask
friendlyName: Publish DACPAC using a DAC Publish Profile
description: Deploys a SQL Server Database DACPAC to a server using a DAC Publish Profile
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe

inputs.name: DacPacPath
inputs.label: DACPAC Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the DacPac to publish.  Wildcards can be used. Note that the repo root is held in the variable $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: DacPublishProfile
inputs.label: DAC Publish Profile Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the DAC Publish Profile. Wildcards can be used.  Note that the repo root is held in the variable $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: TargetServerName
inputs.label: Target Server Name or IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Server Name or IP address.  Include the database instance name and port if necessary (e.g. myserver\myinstance,myport)

inputs.name: TargetDatabaseName
inputs.label: Target Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the database as it should be deployed on the target server. Can be different from the DacPac name.

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariableType
inputs.label: Overwrite SQLCMD Variables Options
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Choose if you wish to overwrite SQLCMD Variables within the DAC Publish Profile and, if so, in which format.
We recommend JSON format as this is easy to validate.

options.text: Multi-line text input as name/value pairs

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInJson
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (JSON format)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in JSON format. 
These will be used to dynamically update the DAC Publish Profile

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInText
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (name/value pair format)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in the format var=varvalue. 
These will be used to dynamically update the DAC Publish Profile

inputs.name: PreferredVersion
inputs.label: SqlPackage.exe Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defines the preferred version of SqlPackage.exe you wish to use.  Use 'latest' for the latest version. If the preferred version cannot be found, the latest version will be used instead.

instanceNameFormat: Publish database $(TargetDatabaseName) using DAC Publish Profile
